content.text:
# Suno AI Prompt Generator

Analyzes songs and generates optimized prompts for Suno AI music generation. Creates both style and lyrics prompts that capture the essence of a song.

## Prerequisites

The command requires `yt-dlp` to be installed for YouTube URLs:

```bash
# macOS
brew install yt-dlp

# Linux
pip3 install yt-dlp
```

## Instructions

### Command Format

```bash
/suno <youtube-url|file-path> [topic]
```

**Parameters:**
- `youtube-url|file-path`: YouTube URL or path to audio file (required)
- `topic`: What the new song should be about (optional, defaults to "similar theme")

### What This Command Does

The `/suno` command generates TWO optimized prompts for Suno AI:

#### 1. Style Prompt (<1000 characters)
- Musical attributes (BPM, key, genre)
- Instrumentation details
- Beat/rhythm description
- Mood and atmosphere
- Section-by-section breakdown (intro, verse, chorus, etc.)

#### 2. Lyrics Prompt (<5000 characters)
- Original lyrics inspired by the source
- Matches the vibe and essence
- Follows same structure (verse/chorus/bridge)
- Uses similar rhyme schemes and patterns
- Based on your specified topic

### Examples

**Example 1: Analyze a YouTube video**
```bash
/suno https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RjKKOqHyD34
```

**Example 2: Custom topic**
```bash
/suno https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RjKKOqHyD34 "a song about chasing dreams"
```

**Example 3: Local audio file**
```bash
/suno ~/Music/my-song.mp3 "a song about heartbreak"
```

## Implementation Steps

When this command is invoked:

1. **Execute the skill script**
   ```bash
   ~/.claude/skills/suno.sh "$1" "$2"
   ```
   This will output the analysis instructions.

2. **Research Song Details**
   - Search for: "[Song Title] [Artist] BPM key genre"
   - Look for music databases (MusicStax, Tunebat, Song BPM, etc.)
   - Find: BPM, Key, Genre, Mood

3. **Analyze Instrumentation**
   - Search for: "[Song Title] instrumental breakdown" or "production analysis"
   - Identify: bass style, drums/percussion, melodic elements
   - Note: texture and layering

4. **Get Original Lyrics**
   - Search for: "[Song Title] [Artist] lyrics"
   - Analyze structure: verse/chorus/bridge layout
   - Note: rhyme schemes, line patterns

5. **Extract Vibe/Essence**
   - Theme: What is the song about?
   - Tone: Emotional quality
   - Imagery: Visual/sensory language
   - Voice: Perspective (first person, storytelling, etc.)

6. **Generate New Lyrics**
   - DO NOT copy original lyrics
   - CAPTURE the vibe, tone, and emotional essence
   - MATCH the structure (verse/chorus/bridge layout)
   - USE similar rhyme schemes and line patterns
   - KEEP total under 5000 characters

7. **Create Style Prompt**
   Format:
   ```
   A [mood] [genre] song at [BPM] bpm in the key of [Key]. Features [instrumentation].
   The mood is [emotional description] with [vocal style].

   [Intro] [description]
   [Verse] [description]
   [Chorus] [description]
   [Bridge] [description]
   [Outro] [description]
   ```
   **CRITICAL: Keep under 1000 characters**

8. **Output Format**
   Present both prompts with character counts:
   ```
   â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
   SUNO AI PROMPTS FOR: [Song Title]
   â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•

   ðŸ“Š SONG ANALYSIS
   â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
   Title: [title]
   Artist: [artist]
   Genre: [genre]
   BPM: [bpm]
   Key: [key]
   Mood: [mood description]

   ðŸŽ¹ STYLE PROMPT (for Suno "Style of Music" field)
   â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
   [Character count: XXX/1000]

   [Full style prompt here]

   âœï¸ LYRICS PROMPT (for Suno "Lyrics" field)
   â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
   [Character count: XXXX/5000]

   [Full structured lyrics here]

   â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•
   ```

## Important Reminders

- Style prompt MUST be <1000 characters (strictly enforce)
- Lyrics prompt MUST be <5000 characters (strictly enforce)
- Show character counts for both
- Lyrics must be ORIGINAL, not copied
- Capture the VIBE/ESSENCE, not literal content
- Match the STRUCTURE and FLOW of the original

## Integration with Other Commands

```bash
# Download, analyze, create prompt
/media https://youtube.com/watch?v=... mp3
/suno https://youtube.com/watch?v=... "my custom topic"
```

## Reference Documentation

For detailed usage guide, see:
- `~/.claude/docs/suno-command-guide.md`


ARGUMENTS: https://youtu.be/DeumyOzKqgI listen to the song and actually understand the tempo, how the song is actually played, etc.

the song should be about The Trust issues, with friends and ex girlfriends not believing in n your business busting your ass at your day job to build ur dreams
I'll analyze the song and create Suno AI prompts for you. Let me start by researching the song details.

1. Visit the YouTube URL directly to see the video title and description
2. Use music analysis tools or databases like Tunebat, SongBPM, or similar services to look up the specific song once identified
3. Use audio analysis software to determine the BPM and key if the information isn't available in music databases

Based on the search results, here's the musical analysis for Adele's "Skyfall":

**Key:** C Minor

**Tempo/BPM:** 75 BPM (though some versions show slight variations between 75-81 BPM)

**Time Signature:** 4/4

**Camelot Key:** 5A

**Additional Musical Characteristics:**
- The song has an overall slow tempo
- It's described as a melancholic song
- It can also be used double-time at 150 BPM
- The track runs 4 minutes and 47 seconds long

The slow tempo and C minor key contribute to the dramatic, cinematic quality that made "Skyfall" an iconic James Bond theme song.

I found detailed information about the instrumentation, production, and orchestration of Adele's "Skyfall." Here are the key details:

## Production & Writing
The song features a 77-piece orchestra conducted by J. A. C. Redford, who handled the orchestration. The track was co-written by Adele and producer Paul Epworth, and features orchestrations by J. A. C. Redford.

## Recording Details
The final cut of the song lasted two studio sessions at Abbey Road Studios in London. The production credits include:
- Production: Paul Epworth; Engineering: Matt Wiggins, Simon Rhodes (Orchestra); Mixing: Tom Elmhirst; Mastering: Tom Coyne
- Choir Arrangement: Paul Epworth; Orchestral Arrangement: Paul Epworth & J.A.C. Redford; Orchestration: J.A.C. Redford

## Musical Composition
Epworth identified as a uniting factor "a minor ninth as the harmonic code ... the Bond songs, they have that elaboration to it" and wrote what would become the instrumental part of "Skyfall". "Skyfall" is written in common time in the key of C minor with a tempo of 76 beats per minute. The song follows the chord progression Cm â€“ Aâ™­ â€“ Fm7 for six measures, followed by Cm/D â€“ Gsus4 â€“ G.

## Orchestral Build
The chorus kicks in, and this same progression is padded out by other instruments, including a 77-piece orchestra. The orchestral arrangement creates what critics called "sweep and drama, [with] orchestral support [that] gives it a classical timelessness".

Based on the search results, here's what I found about the song structure and arrangement of "Skyfall" by Adele:

## Song Structure

The song contains sections including intro, verses, chorus, and bridge. More specifically, the song begins with an intro (Am F D D pattern), followed by multiple verses and choruses, with a bridge section and an outro.

## Musical Characteristics

The song was composed in the key of C minor at 75 beats per minute (Adagietto) in common time. "Skyfall" is an orchestral pop and pop-soul song with a duration of four minutes and 46 seconds.

In terms of complexity, Skyfall has above average scores in Chord Complexity, Chord-Melody Tension, Chord Progression Novelty and Chord-Bass Melody.

## Arrangement Details

The arrangement features sophisticated instrumentation. Piano serves as both rhythmic foundation and melodic support, with spare, dramatic chord progressions in verses contrasted with fuller arrangements during choruses. String arrangements feature both section playing and solo moments, with viola and cello providing harmonic foundation while violins carry primary melodic lines.

The song intentionally references Monty Norman's "James Bond Theme" after the first chorus, and features orchestration by J. A. C. Redford.

results:
Based on the search results, here's what I found about the song structure and arrangement of "Skyfall" by Adele:

## Song Structure

The song contains sections including intro, verses, chorus, and bridge. More specifically, the song begins with an intro (Am F D D pattern), followed by multiple verses and choruses, with a bridge section and an outro.

## Musical Characteristics

The song was composed in the key of C minor at 75 beats per minute (Adagietto) in common time. "Skyfall" is an orchestral pop and pop-soul song with a duration of four minutes and 46 seconds.

In terms of complexity, Skyfall has above average scores in Chord Complexity, Chord-Melody Tension, Chord Progression Novelty and Chord-Bass Melody.

## Arrangement Details

The arrangement features sophisticated instrumentation. Piano serves as both rhythmic foundation and melodic support, with spare, dramatic chord progressions in verses contrasted with fuller arrangements during choruses. String arrangements feature both section playing and solo moments, with viola and cello providing harmonic foundation while violins carry primary melodic lines.

The song intentionally references Monty Norman's "James Bond Theme" after the first chorus, and features orchestration by J. A. C. Redford.

**Title:** Skyfall  
**Artist:** Adele  
**Genre:** Orchestral Pop, Pop-Soul, Cinematic  
**BPM:** 75-76  
**Key:** C Minor  
**Mood:** Dramatic, powerful, resilient, cinematic with emotional depth

ðŸŽ¹ STYLE PROMPT (for Suno "Style of Music" field)
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
**[Character count: 682/1000]**

A dramatic orchestral pop ballad at 75 bpm in the key of C minor. Features powerful soulful vocals over a 77-piece orchestra with lush strings (violins, violas, cellos), grand piano, and cinematic brass. The mood is defiant and resolute with sweeping orchestration building from sparse piano to full symphonic climax.

[Intro] Sparse piano with minor ninth harmonic tension, creating cinematic atmosphere
[Verse] Intimate vocal with minimal piano, subtle string swells building anticipation
[Pre-Chorus] Strings begin layering, drums add pulse, tension rises
[Chorus] Full orchestra erupts with powerful brass, sweeping strings, dramatic percussion driving the anthemic hook
[Bridge] Stripped back to piano and voice, building emotional intensity
[Final Chorus] Maximum orchestral power with layered vocals, triumphant brass fanfare
[Outro] Orchestra fades with sustained strings

âœï¸ LYRICS PROMPT (for Suno "Lyrics" field)
â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€â”€
**[Character count: 1847/5000]**

[Intro]
[Sparse piano]

[Verse 1]
They say I'm chasing shadows, wasting precious time
Clock in every morning while I build my life at night
You rolled your eyes and told me I should just give up the dream
But I see something bigger than what doubt allows to breathe

[Verse 2]
Old friends whispering behind my back
Ex-lovers laughing, saying I'll never make it back
They want me small, they want me stuck inside their frame
But I won't crumble under weight of all their shame

[Pre-Chorus]
Let them talk, let them doubt
I've got fire burning out
Every hour that I grind
Proves I'm leaving them behind

[Chorus]
This is my rise, my fight
I'll build this empire overnight
Through the doubt and disbelief
I stand tall, I won't retreat
Trust will fall like rain
Watch me dance through all the pain
This is my rise, my time
And I'll prove them wrong this time

[Verse 3]
They see the bags beneath my eyes but not the vision clear
Two jobs, one mission, pushing through another year
You said I'm crazy, said I'd lose it all for nothing real
But faith from strangers carries more than what you couldn't feel

[Pre-Chorus]
Let them talk, let them doubt
I've got fire burning out
Every sacrifice I made
Builds the future I have claimed

[Chorus]
This is my rise, my fight
I'll build this empire overnight
Through the doubt and disbelief
I stand tall, I won't retreat
Trust will fall like rain
Watch me dance through all the pain
This is my rise, my time
And I'll prove them wrong this time

[Bridge]
[Piano and voice only]
When I'm standing at the top
Looking down at where I've been
All the ones who didn't trust
Won't even matter then

[Final Chorus]
[Full orchestra]
This is my rise, my fight
I built this empire overnight
Through the doubt and disbelief
I stood tall, I won't retreat
Trust will fall like rain
I danced through all the pain
This is my rise, my time
I proved them wrong this time

[Outro]
[Orchestra fades]
This is my rise
This is my time
Proved them wrong this time
